column4: hello - I got a question about user programs menu - applications:/// in nautilus doesn't work - is this broken in hoary?
why it this broken or there is another solution?
because menus follow the freedesktop policy, and there is not a GUI for changing them right now
I guess someone is working to make that possible
AFAIK davyd was working on this to enable menus editing in 2.10
the SAME menus are now available through both gnome and KDE
there will not be any way to edit menus in future in gnome?
now you can wait or to see how to manually editing them :-(
I don't know but I really expect so!
I mean I expect they will be editable again
I understand that developers want them to be compatible with freedesktop spec
perhaps it is just a question of writting a new gnome_vfs plugin for the new menus or sth like that
but for me it's yet another feature regression in gnome :(
let's hope it is yet another transient feature regression
perhaps you have to use KDE to edit the menus :-P
